column4: I dont know how, I am journalist and linux user, not programmer neither computing engeneer :D
I need to make partitions before and Linux cant see the partitions that I just have now
instalator program and gparted show only the HD, not the NFTS partitions neither free partition
And I just can't understand that answer
I'm using linux since 1998
debian user since potato, and now ubuntu linux user
I use Linux, OSX and now I NEED Windows for A. Premiere :L)
I installed OSX/Win7/Ubuntu successfully  http://www.insanelymac.com/forum/index.php?showtopic=212837&st=0#entry1427797
I dont want to know anything of apple
in english, please xD
talk me like If I was really stupid xD
What could I try?

first: gptscyh is a utility commonly used by multibooters for installing OSX and Ubuntu on the same HDD.  It addresses the different bootup structure.  sudo apt-get install to get gptsync.  Then you invoke it at the command line.  IT REWRITES THE MBR...
I created USB ubuntu, installed gptsync, sync'd my HDD and haven't had  boot problem since.
is that in reposotories?
gptsync in in the universe repos
is normal that fdisk can see the partitions and not gparted?
not in my experience...
agreed
gpt and mbr are different partitioning schemes.  gpt = apple, mbr = windows/default buntu
see http://manpages.ubuntu.com/manpages/maverick/man8/gdisk.8.html
